results.title: Bertrand Russell discusses happiness
results.brief_description: Lord Russell describes the factors which he considers necessary for happiness: health, sufficient means to keep one from want, happy personal relations and successful work. He also discusses what he considers to be the sources of unhappiness: worry, envy and boredom. No other credits available.

results.title: My friend Hans from Germany
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “My Friend”.
Tells something of the life of Hans, a German boy living in the village of Garmisch-Partenkirchen near Munich in Bavaria. Shows the harvest season and the unusual tradition of sheltering cattle under houses. Throughout the year Hans goes skiing on the nearby Zugspitz Mountain.

results.title: Hands, knees and bumps-a-daisy
results.creator_credit: National Coal Board and TV Cartoons
results.brief_description: A short and amusing animated industrial safety film in which Stanley Unwin exhorts his audience to safeguard themselves against injury in their work by wearing the protective gloves and knee-pads provided. Also considers the hazards of working in mines.

results.title: Hands in Harmony
results.creator_credit: Douglas Tunstell, Sydney Newman and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: One of a series of films featuring Canadian musical talent. Saskatchewan’s Neil Chotem, composer, conductor and concert pianist, plays Chopin’s Black Key Study and Study in E Major.

results.title: Handling the catch
results.creator_credit: Dennis Shand, Central Office of Information and Film Workshop
results.brief_description: For five days and nights a trawler steams up the east coast of Britain to reach the northern fishing grounds of the Atlantic. The object of this routine voyage is to spend two weeks catching, preserving and landing some twelve thousand pounds worth of high quality white fish. The importance of cleanliness, care and cooling is stressed in order to preserve a profitable catch.

results.title: Characteristics and handling of materials
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Sewing”.
Shows how to handle various types of materials, including cottons, woollens, silks and such synthetic fabrics as rayons, in preparation for sewing.

results.title: Handling dangerous chemicals: bases
results.brief_description: Explains the characteristics of bases, the solubility of sodium hydroxide pellets in the air, proper techniques for dissolving solid bases in water and stoppering reagent bottles.

results.title: Handling dangerous chemicals: acids
results.brief_description: Shows the viscosity of concentrated acids, effects of nitric hydrochloric and sulphuric acids on skin and on clothing. Demonstrates the proper techniques for diluting concentrated acids and the use of emergency fountains to flush acids from the face and eyes.
results.description: Shows the viscosity of concentrated acids, effects of nitric hydrochloric and sulphuric acids on skin and on clothing. Demonstrates the proper techniques for diluting concentrated acids and the use of emergency fountains to flush acids from the face and eyes.

results.title: Handle with care
results.brief_description: Shows the various processes involved in the production of a modern long-playing record from the recording session to the final disc. The importance of quality control is emphasised at each stage of the process. Includes cutting the acetate disc from the tape, processing of the acetate disc to give the final stamper, and the stamping of records from a mixture of polymer, stabilizer and carbon black.
